title: Hebrew calendar dates (en)
caldesc: Displays the Hebrew date every day of the week in English transliteration
descLong:
Displays the Hebrew date (such as 18th of Tevet) every day of the week. Sephardic transliteration.

Hebrew year is included in event title on the 1st of each month (e.g. 1st of Kislev, 5782)

title: Yom Kippur Katan
caldesc: ×™×•Ö¹× ×›Ö¼Ö´×¤Ö¼×•Ö¼×¨ ×§Ö¸×˜Ö¸×Ÿ, minor day of atonement on the day preceeding each Rosh Chodesh
descLong:
×™×•Ö¹× ×›Ö´Ö¼×¤Ö¼×•Ö¼×¨ ×§Ö¸×˜Ö¸×Ÿ is a minor day of atonement occurring monthly on the day preceding each Rosh Chodesh.

Yom Kippur Katan is omitted in Elul (on the day before Rosh Hashanah), Tishrei (Yom Kippur has just passed), Kislev (due to Chanukah) or Nisan (fasting not permitted during Nisan). When Rosh Chodesh occurs on Shabbat or Sunday, Yom Kippur Katan is observed on the preceding Thursday. [1]

title: Rosh Chodesh
caldesc: Rosh Chodesh is a minor holiday observed at the beginning of every month in the Hebrew calendar
descLong: Rosh Chodesh is a minor holiday observed at the beginning of every month in the Hebrew calendar, marked by the birth of a new moon

title: Shabbat Mevarchim
caldesc: Shabbat announcing new month,Prior to Rosh Chodesh
descLong: Shabbat before Rosh Chodesh is known as Shabbat Mevarchim, "the Shabbat when we bless." Each event in the feed also includes details on the molad, the moment the new moon is born

title: Yizkor (Diaspora)
caldesc: Ashkenazi Jewish memorial prayer service for the dead recited in synagogue during four holidays yearly
descLong:
Ashkenazi Jewish memorial prayer service for the dead recited in synagogue during four holidays yearly. Diaspora schedule.

  • Pesach 8th day
  • Shavuot 2nd day
  • Yom Kippur
  • Shmini Atzeret
